attributes.action: car insurance should be calculated on drivers no claim, not on the area.
attributes.additional_details:
Just simple example: if u live in the good post code u can have nice car and cheap car insurance and if u just move to another post code with the same nice car but the area is little bit strange u car insurance go so high just because of area don't matter how good u driving and don't matter how many of years have no accidents.
this should be changed to treat people fairly!!!
attributes.background: all car insurance should be calculated on drivers no claims bonus not on the area where the drivers lives, because that's not fair for so many people who driving so many years and have no accident and if they live in bad areas still they have to pay so much money for car insurance and that's wrong.

rejection.details:
Please note that a petition already exists on this issue:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/190066
